column4: I'm installing Wine in software center, but it seems to be stuck at a certain point in "applying changes," what should I do?
wine pulls in a lot of dependancies, give it some time. it might also popped up a windows for accepting some eula
already popped that window, I accepted
and it's been stuck for a good 20 minutes
hmm, that's not right
if you're really sure it has stopped, cancel the install, stop the software center and install wine from a terminal to see what happens
how do I cancel the install? there's no X button next to it :/
no cancel button next to the progress bar?
correct
k, just quit software center and install from the command line
yeah, but quitting software center doesn't actually stop the install, so I can't get lock on whatever
you mean apt-get can't get a lock using sudo?
yeah, but I pkilled update notifier and package-data-do
so apt-get is running now
ok...
apparently, it's getting stuck on downloading the mscorefonts or whatever, from sourceforge (I'm behind GFW, so this crap happens all the time)
ahh, that explains it. maybe retrying hits another mirror that is reachable?
ttf-mscorefonts-installer: downloading http://downloads.sourceforge.net/corefonts/andale32.exe and nothing after that, seems like it's just not gonna get it
vpn time
other that using an open proxy, i wouldn't know how to fix that
or vpn as you said :)
